name: Doppeldeutsch am Morgen
description: This is a conversational German support group designed for primary school students who have recently arrived in Germany and currently have little to no knowledge of the German language. The focus of this offering is to provide students with regular and low-threshold exposure to everyday German through guided conversations, interactive language games, and simple vocabulary building activities. The aim is to strengthen their confidence in using the language and to support their integration into daily school life.

name: Intermediate Guitar Ensemble
description: In this club, we support and advance students’ journey with the guitar. We aim to expand their abilities by providing a space where they can discover their personal connection with the instrument and enhance their skills in a safe, non judgmental environment that fosters individuality and originality. The club also prepares for seasonal performances and encourages students to perform regularly in front of their peers, promoting confidence and stage presence.

name: BCS Concert Band
description: BCS Concert Band is an ensemble lead by Mr Lloyd which incorporates our wind and brass players. The Concert Band will focus on many different styles of music in an ensemble setting, supporting students to develop their playing and explore new styles of music.

name: Yoga Beginners
description: We will learn basic yoga postures and do breathwork for calming/anxiety/relaxation. The flows will differ each week, with beginning-intermediate-advanced options.

name: Spanish 1
description: This club is for students who are interested in taking the official diploma of the Spanish language DELE (Diploma de español como lengua extranjera). Anyone can take it in the 6 different levels: A1, A2, B1, B2, C1 or C2. Make sure to seize the chance to take this prestigious exam.

name: Journalism
description: In the Communication Skills and Journalism club, students will learn how to express themselves clearly, confidently, and effectively. They'll practice public speaking, active listening, interviewing, and teamwork through fun activities and real-world scenarios. Kids will also explore the basics of journalism—how to research, write news stories, and report with accuracy and fairness. This club builds confidence, critical thinking, and strong communication habits that will serve students in school and beyond.

name: Parkour
description: The club starts by gathering students in the front yard, where we briefly decide on the parkour location for the day. We have several locations in Berlin, all conveniently accessible by public transportation. Once we arrive at our destination, we begin with a warm-up before starting our practice. Each location offers unique parkour experiences, ensuring that every session is different and exciting.

name: Theater
description: Together in the group, we will develop an intercultural piece by learning the basics of body language, facial expressions, and gestures. You will learn how to consciously use your voice, language, and media to bring your performance idea to life with your friends.

name: Stop Motion Animation Movie
description: Students will learn about different analogue and digital techniques for making stop motion animation. They will work in small groups to develop their own characters - either by drawing in 2d or modelling from plasticine in 3d - and stories, then create short movies by taking photos using a stop motion app on an iPad. Students will also look at how to add titles, audio and some special effects to complete their movies.

name: Coding 1
description: Students will explore the fundamentals of coding computer programs. We will begin the year with Hour of Code challenges, and then move on to using Scratch to understand introductory coding concepts. This class is designed for students with little to no experience with Scratch.

name: Ballet 1
description: The methodology of the ballet classes is structured to suit the age and anatomy of the children and young people. Objective at the End of the school year: To understand what they have learned and show it in a choreography.

name: Boom & Beats
description: This group is for young musicians who want to discover the power of rhythm through percussion and idiophones. By exploring different instruments and building a strong rhythmic foundation, students' overall learning will be enhanced. No prior experience needed - just join in and let's have fun making music together.

name: Creative Movie Maker
description: If you’ve ever wanted to work both in front of and behind the camera, join our creative club. We will produce our own short films in various genres, using different techniques. Ms. Polgar, a film expert who works with several schools and cultural institutions in the field of art and film, will support you and your ideas.

name: Doppeldeutsch
description: This mixed-age support program is designed for primary school students in Grades 3 to 6 who have been formally diagnosed with dyslexia or are in the process of receiving a diagnosis. The focus of this specialized language offer is to strengthen reading and writing skills in German in a supportive, structured, and multisensory learning environment.

name: BCS Symphoria
description: BCS Symphoria is the school's pre-advanced string orchestra. Students practice diverse repertoire each week and are given the chance to perform on concerts and projects both at school and outside of school. A highlight of the 25/26 school year will be a performance at the Klangwerkstadt in Kreuzberg on November 16 2025. Symphoria serves as the 3rd music lesson for middle school students in the string classes and music teachers will confirm that students are in the correct level.

name: Spanish 2
description: This club is for students who are interested in taking the official diploma of the Spanish language DELE (Diploma de español como lengua extranjera). Anyone can take it in the 6 different levels: A1, A2, B1, B2, C1 or C2. Make sure to seize the chance to take this prestigious exam.

name: Rock band 2
description: Each band will have live concerts, weekly rehearsals, and the chance to write and record their own songs. All band members should have at least one private music lesson per week.

name: Coding Secondary
description: Students will build on their prior coding knowledge to start creating their own programs using the Python language. We will begin by reviewing coding concepts through Scratch or CodeCombat, and then progress to writing actual Python code to develop our own programs. This class is recommended for students who have previously used Scratch or have an introductory knowledge of Python.

name: Robotics
description: Students will work with Vex Robots and Lego Mindstorms and take part in robotics competitions. The main idea is to develop their own robots.

name: Parkour Secondary
description: The club starts by gathering students in the front yard, where we briefly decide on the parkour location for the day. We have several locations in Berlin, all conveniently accessible by public transportation. Once we arrive at our destination, we begin with a warm-up before starting our practice. Each location offers unique parkour experiences, ensuring that every session is different and exciting.

name: Ballet 4 Performance
description: The methodology of the ballet classes is structured to suit the age and anatomy of the children and young people. Objective at the End of the school year: To understand what they have learned and show it in a choreography.

name: Chess 1
description: Join the chess club to learn strategies, play friendly matches, compete in mini-tournaments, and receive guidance from both peers and teachers to improve your skills.

name: Doppeldeutsch am Morgen
description: This is a conversational German support group designed for primary school students who have recently arrived in Germany and currently have little to no knowledge of the German language. The focus of this offering is to provide students with regular and low-threshold exposure to everyday German through guided conversations, interactive language games, and simple vocabulary building activities. The aim is to strengthen their confidence in using the language and to support their integration into daily school life.

name: Orchestra Arco
description: 3rd music lesson choice for all students beginning a string instrument (violin, viola, cello, bass). Students should be pre-registered through their music teachers. Please contact music teachers with any questions.

name: Music Theory
description: A morning tutorial focused on supporting students to develop and practice their music theory, allowing students to improve their understanding of music and the theory behind it. Students will be assigned by music teachers but are also encouraged to sign up.

name: Tap Dance 3
description: The basic elements of American Tap Dance are taught here. Through the rhythmic footwork, the learners in class thus become percussion musicians. At the same time, a total body training takes place. Balance, arm and body postures and formations are trained and everything is reflected in a choreographic development.

name: Woodworking
description: In our Woodworking Club, creativity meets craftsmanship. Students specialize in constructing a variety of wooden objects, from intricate figures and delightful toys to engaging board games and challenging puzzles. Whether you're a seasoned woodworker or a curious beginner, you'll find a supportive community eager to share skills and inspire new projects.

name: Claymodelling
description: The 1 Hour Club introduces students to the basics of clay modeling, covering techniques, materials, and tools. During the club, children are encouraged to develop their own ideas with the support of the teacher, fellow students, and helpful videos or images. Additionally, students will learn about ceramic and terracotta art through the use of the kiln.

name: Cooking 1
description: Do you know how good sliced garlic smells in a pan with olive oil? What does a vanilla bean look like? And why does grandma´s apple pie always taste the best? You will find it out. While cooking and baking together, we embark on a journey of discovery through the different cultures of the world. We are keen to experiment and taste the variety of different spices. We eagerly await the moment when our creations will finally be on the plate and can be tasted.

name: Canta Cosmo Primary Choir
description: Calling all primary students who love to sing! This is a children's choir that will sing in multiple languages and styles, with a special focus on preparing for the 6k United project in summer 2026 in the Uber arena.

name: Judo 1
instructor: Mr. Niklas Seidenstücker from KiK e.V.
description: Judo is renowned for its spectacular throws and incorporates a significant amount of wrestling. It emphasizes a built-in etiquette that requires respect, good manners, and proper behaviour. The goal is not to cause harm, but to execute throws with speed and skill. Practicing judo helps students develop self-discipline, self-confidence, concentration, physical coordination, and flexibility.

name: Soccer (boys/girls)
description: Join our Soccer Club where everyone—girls and boys—can play in a fun, safe environment! Whether you're new to the sport or already know a little, we’ll help you learn at your own pace while enjoying the game. Teamwork, skills, and lots of fun are waiting for you!

name: Hip Hop & Streetdance 1
description: Jazz dance incorporates elements of modern dance and African-American dance. The play of dynamics, isolation movements of the whole body and rhythmic work characterise the lessons. Street dance is a general umbrella term for urban dance styles such as break dance, crumping, popping, locking and hip hop that have developed in the scene. Here, too, the play of dynamics, isolation movements of the whole body characterise and are thus a suitable complement in connection with the technique of jazz dance. The development and presentation of different choreographies are part of the lessons.

name: Japanese Primary
description: Explore the fascinating world of Japan through its language and culture! Whether you're a beginner or have some experience, this club is for all levels. We’ll learn basic phrases, traditional customs, and fun cultural activities together. Join us to discover a new language and experience Japan in a fun way!

name: Claymodelling 1
description: The 1 Hour Club introduces students to the basics of clay modeling, covering techniques, materials, and tools. During the club, children are encouraged to develop their own ideas with the support of the teacher, fellow students, and helpful videos or images. Additionally, students will learn about ceramic and terracotta art through the use of the kiln.

name: Judo 2
instructor: Mr. Niklas Seidenstücker from KiK e.V.
description: Judo is renowned for its spectacular throws and incorporates a significant amount of wrestling. It emphasizes a built-in etiquette that requires respect, good manners, and proper behaviour. The goal is not to cause harm, but to execute throws with speed and skill. Practicing judo helps students develop self-discipline, self-confidence, concentration, physical coordination, and flexibility.

name: BCS NEWS Broadcasting
description: We will publish a monthly school newspaper, make videos with our own equipment, and learn about journalism and reporting. We're looking forward to organizing excursions to Deutsche Welle and ARD/ZDF in the future.

name: Cosmo Philharmonic
description: Cosmo Philharmonic is BCS’s premier string orchestra, open to advanced student musicians. Members rehearse weekly, exploring a diverse repertoire spanning from the Baroque era to contemporary works. The ensemble performs regularly both on and off campus and occasionally participates in special tours and trips. Cosmo Philharmonic frequently collaborates with other top-level ensembles, including the Jazz Ensemble, Advanced Guitars, and the BCS Community Choir.

name: Advanced Guitar Ensemble
description: In this club, we support and advance students’ journey with the guitar. We aim to expand their abilities by providing a space where they can discover their personal connection with the instrument and enhance their skills in a safe, non judgmental environment that fosters individuality and originality. The club also prepares for seasonal performances and encourages students to perform regularly in front of their peers, promoting confidence and stage presence.

name: BCS Community Choir
description: The BCS Community Choir brings together students, parents, staff, and community members to make music in a welcoming and collaborative environment. Rehearsals focus on a wide range of vocal repertoire and offer opportunities for participants to grow musically while preparing for performances both at school and in the broader community. Some prior singing experience is preferred, but all enthusiastic singers are encouraged to join.

name: Jazz Band
description: Advanced Jazz band including rhythm section (Drums, double bass, Piano) plus winds/brass Instruments. In addition to practicing weekly, the band is often featured at public concerts and various school events. Admission to the ensemble is pending audition/Mr. Lloyd's approval.

name: Coding
description: Students will explore the fundamentals of coding computer programs. We will begin the year with Hour of Code challenges, and then move on to using Scratch to understand introductory coding concepts. This class is designed for students with little to no experience with Scratch.

name: Beginner Guitar Ensemble
description: Students will be assigned by teachers and will use this class to prepare for guitar class in 7th grade, or improve during their school year.

name: Beginners Brass and Woodwind
description: This is the third music lesson recommendation for 5th graders beginning trumpet and trombone. Students will be pre-registered for the course by the music department. Any other beginning brass players wishing to join, please contact the music department.

name: Tap Dance 1-Beginners
description: The basic elements of American Tap Dance are taught here. Through the rhythmic footwork, the learners in class thus become percussion musicians. At the same time, a total body training takes place. Balance, arm and body postures and formations are trained and everything is reflected in a choreographic development.

name: Basketball 1
description: Students will receive an introduction to the skills and strategies of the game and will be organized in teams to compete on an intramural basis.

name: Claymodelling 2
description: The 1 Hour Club introduces students to the basics of clay modeling, covering techniques, materials, and tools. During the club, children are encouraged to develop their own ideas with the support of the teacher, fellow students, and helpful videos or images. Additionally, students will learn about ceramic and terracotta art through the use of the kiln.

name: Russian 1
description: We offer beginner courses tailored for both primary and secondary students, ensuring a strong foundation in Russian language skills. Additionally, we provide an advanced course designed for students who wish to progress further or for those who speak Russian as their home language. These courses are structured to cater to different proficiency levels, making sure every student can learn and grow at their own pace. Come explore the richness of the Russian language and culture in a supportive and dynamic environment.

name: French Primary
description: This year, the French club will emphasize expanding vocabulary and constructing longer sentences in French through engaging activities like games, stories, and songs. Everyone is welcome, whether your child is a complete beginner or has been a member for a year or two—they will still learn plenty of new things. The club is conducted primarily in French and will also feature enjoyable cultural activities such as making crêpes and savoring delicious macarons.

name: Agents of Deception
description: Step into the world of mystery, strategy, and secrets! In the Agents of Deception Club, you’ll learn the art of disguise, misdirection, and problem-solving. Together, we’ll solve puzzles, uncover hidden clues, and put your critical thinking to the test. Do you have what it takes to outsmart the competition? Join us and become a master of deception!

name: Cooking 2
description: Do you know how good sliced garlic smells in a pan with olive oil? What does a vanilla bean look like? And why does grandma´s apple pie always taste the best? You will find it out. While cooking and baking together, we embark on a journey of discovery through the different cultures of the world. We are keen to experiment and taste the variety of different spices. We eagerly await the moment when our creations will finally be on the plate and can be tasted.

name: Guided Relaxation
description: This club is designed for children and pre teenagers, in which the can practice relaxing their body and mind while being guided through different scenarios.

name: Junior Performance Kids
description: Here the children come in addition to the selected Ballet Club! (Ballet 2-3rd-5th grade). These 75 minutes on Wednesday are necessary to work on and deepen choreographies!

name: Basketball 2
description: Students will receive an introduction to the skills and strategies of the game and will be organized in teams to compete on an intramural basis.

name: Claymodelling 3
description: The 1 Hour Club introduces students to the basics of clay modeling, covering techniques, materials, and tools. During the club, children are encouraged to develop their own ideas with the support of the teacher, fellow students, and helpful videos or images. Additionally, students will learn about ceramic and terracotta art through the use of the kiln.

name: Costume Design
description: Do you love dressing up or imagining new characters? In this club, you’ll get to explore your creativity by drawing costume ideas, learning how to put pieces together, and even making your own costume parts using fabric, paper, and fun craft materials. Whether it's for a play, a party, or just for fun—you’ll bring your wildest costume ideas to life!

name: Flag Football
description: Instead of tackling, you just pull a flag from the other player's belt to stop the play. It's a fun, fast-paced game that helps you build teamwork, stay active, and learn the basics of football—all without the rough contact! Everyone gets a chance to run, pass, and score touchdowns. Come join us for some friendly competition and loads of fun!

name: Chess 2
description: Join the chess club to learn strategies, play friendly matches, compete in mini-tournaments, and receive guidance from both peers and teachers to improve your skills.

name: Robotics
description: Students will work with Vex Robots and Lego Mindstorms and take part in robotics competitions. The main idea is to develop their own robots.

name: Russian 2
description: We offer beginner courses tailored for both primary and secondary students, ensuring a strong foundation in Russian language skills. Additionally, we provide an advanced course designed for students who wish to progress further or for those who speak Russian as their home language. These courses are structured to cater to different proficiency levels, making sure every student can learn and grow at their own pace. Come explore the richness of the Russian language and culture in a supportive and dynamic environment.

name: Rock band 3
description: Each band will have live concerts, weekly rehearsals, and the chance to write and record their own songs. All band members should have at least one private music lesson per week.

name: Fun Facts
description: For curious minds and quiz lovers! Do you enjoy random trivia, pub quiz challenges, and Jeopardy-style showdowns? Then The Fun Facts Club is for you! Open to all secondary school students, this club is the place to test your knowledge, discover fascinating facts, and most importantly—have fun!

name: French
description: This year, the French club will emphasize expanding vocabulary and constructing longer sentences in French through engaging activities like games, stories, and songs. Everyone is welcome, whether your child is a complete beginner or has been a member for a year or two—they will still learn plenty of new things. The club is conducted primarily in French and will also feature enjoyable cultural activities such as making crêpes and savoring delicious macarons.

name: Storytelling Communications
description: In the Storytelling and Story Development club, students will explore the art of crafting and sharing compelling stories. Through fun, creative activities, they’ll learn how to develop characters, build plotlines, create settings, and understand story structure. Whether writing, acting out, or presenting stories, kids will strengthen their imagination, writing skills, and confidence in self-expression. This club encourages creativity, collaboration, and a love for storytelling in all its forms.

name: Junior Performance Class
description: Here the children come in addition to the selected Ballet Club! (Ballet 3-5th-8th grade). These 90 minutes on Wednesday are necessary to work on and deepen choreographies!

name: Manga & Comics
description: In this club, students will explore the techniques of drawing, coloring, and inking, with a focus on creating storyboards, sketches, and characters suitable for a final Manga or Comics artwork. Throughout the school year, students will learn the foundational skills needed to bring their own concepts to life, whether it’s an action comic, a school teen manga, a cartoon, or an illustration series. Our goal is to create with fun while learning various art techniques using different tools and media.

name: Russian Secondary
description: We offer beginner courses tailored for both primary and secondary students, ensuring a strong foundation in Russian language skills. Additionally, we provide an advanced course designed for students who wish to progress further or for those who speak Russian as their home language. These courses are structured to cater to different proficiency levels, making sure every student can learn and grow at their own pace. Come explore the richness of the Russian language and culture in a supportive and dynamic environment.

name: Performance Class
description: The learners are introduced to different dance styles such as classical dance, jazz & street dance and modern dance. Given choreographies and own pieces are developed. The aim is, among other things, to present the examination papers of the IB Dance students and the Abitur Additional Dance Course. To become a member of the Performance Class, students must attend Performance Class training twice a week. Auditions are required for admission!

name: Violin 1
description: This is the third music lesson opportunity for most second grade violin students as well as first graders with previous experience and students new to the violin. It is open for students of gr. 1-5 to register. Most students are pre-registered by the music department.

name: Doppeldeutsch am Morgen
description: This is a conversational German support group designed for primary school students who have recently arrived in Germany and currently have little to no knowledge of the German language. The focus of this offering is to provide students with regular and low-threshold exposure to everyday German through guided conversations, interactive language games, and simple vocabulary building activities. The aim is to strengthen their confidence in using the language and to support their integration into daily school life.

name: French DELF
description: Extend your skills in French and get a reward. In the DELF club, we offer the students the possibility to prepare the official French-language diploma awarded by France's Ministry of National Education. It is recognized around the world and is valid for life. As an official certification of second-language proficiency, the DELF tests the ability of students to use French in real-life situations. The students will practice during the whole year and have the possibility to sit the exam at the end of the school year. The French level needed can be from beginner to advanced.

name: Orchestra Brio
description: Orchestra Brio is a highly recommended enrichment lesson for students in the strings class in grades 4-5 and advanced 3rd graders. In addition to practicing each week, the orchestra will perform at 1-2 public concerts throughout the school year.

name: Tap Dance 4
description: The basic elements of American Tap Dance are taught here. Through the rhythmic footwork, the learners in class thus become percussion musicians. At the same time, a total body training takes place. Balance, arm and body postures and formations are trained and everything is reflected in a choreographic development.

name: Claymodelling 4
description: The 1 Hour Club introduces students to the basics of clay modeling, covering techniques, materials, and tools. During the club, children are encouraged to develop their own ideas with the support of the teacher, fellow students, and helpful videos or images. Additionally, students will learn about ceramic and terracotta art through the use of the kiln.

name: Woodworking
description: In our Woodworking Club, creativity meets craftsmanship. Students specialize in constructing a variety of wooden objects, from intricate figures and delightful toys to engaging board games and challenging puzzles. Whether you're a seasoned woodworker or a curious beginner, you'll find a supportive community eager to share skills and inspire new projects.

name: Ukulele
description: The Ukulele Club is open for students of all experience levels to get to know the ukulele, learn chords, strumming patterns, and read lead sheets.

name: Creative Writing
description: In the Creative Writing club, students will dive into the world of words and imagination. They’ll explore different writing styles such as poetry, short stories, and personal narratives while learning key elements like voice, tone, dialogue, and descriptive language. Through guided prompts, group activities, and independent projects, kids will build confidence in their writing, develop their unique style, and have fun expressing themselves creatively.

name: Math Club Primary
description: The Math Club is for young learners who want to explore the exciting side of math! Through games, puzzles, and creative problem-solving, students will develop critical thinking skills and build a strong mathematical foundation. It’s all about enjoying the process of solving problems and discovering new ways to think.

name: Doppeldeutsch
description: This mixed-age support program is designed for primary school students in Grades 3 to 6 who have been formally diagnosed with dyslexia or are in the process of receiving a diagnosis. The focus of this specialized language offer is to strengthen reading and writing skills in German in a supportive, structured, and multisensory learning environment.

We eagerly await the moment when our creations will finally be on the plate and can be tasted.

name: Dance and Stretching
description: What could be better than dancing and being flexible! In this course the focus is on mobility, rhythm and flexibility. First easy "acrobatics" exercises are created. Small presentations and dance choreographies will then be developed into "acrobatic dance". Furthermore, the overall body development is trained, the joy of movement and our self-confidence.

name: Taiji Quan
description: TaiJi Quan is a Chinese martial art renowned for its slow, deliberate movements. Our club sessions include warm-up QiGong exercises (focused on breathing and energy) and practicing various forms. The benefits of TaiJi Quan include improved balance, situational awareness, physical body sense, mental concentration, and relaxation. Additionally, students have the opportunity to learn staff or narrow blade sword/stick forms. This club is particularly recommended for taller students with back and knee problems, as it can help retrain the body’s structural alignment to address postural issues.

name: Science
description: This club is perfect for students interested in exploring various sciences. We will conduct numerous experiments in physics, chemistry, biology, and other natural sciences to build a foundational understanding of the scientific method and experimental design. Students will gain hands-on experience through our activities, helping them develop a solid understanding that will prepare them for science courses in secondary school.

name: Girls Basketball
description: Students will work on skills and strategies of the game and will be organized in teams to compete on an intramural basis.

name: Claymodelling 5
description: The 1 Hour Club introduces students to the basics of clay modeling, covering techniques, materials, and tools. During the club, children are encouraged to develop their own ideas with the support of the teacher, fellow students, and helpful videos or images. Additionally, students will learn about ceramic and terracotta art through the use of the kiln.

name: Flauto Grande
description: Flauto Grande club/ensemble is for 3rd and 4th graders with experience playing the recorder (Blockflöte) in music lessons. The ensemble practices music slightly more advanced than in the music lessons and has the opportunity to perform at various concerts. Students in this ensemble practice at home as well.

name: Math Club Secondary
description: The Math Club is for young learners who want to explore the exciting side of math! Through games, puzzles, and creative problem-solving, students will develop critical thinking skills and build a strong mathematical foundation. It’s all about enjoying the process of solving problems and discovering new ways to think.

name: DIY Electronics
description: Are you interested in building electronic devices like wearable flashing LED lights, robots, or Bluetooth speakers? Then DIY Electronics Maker is the club for you. We take the basic electronics learned in the classroom and apply them to creative projects. Here, we collaborate with the “Repair Café” to help fix broken electronics and work alongside the “Upcycling” club to create wearable electronics. Students will sew multi-colored flashing lights into jackets and jeans, transforming their favorite clothing into unique, illuminated designs. Other exciting projects include synthesizers, audio amplifiers, and radio transmitters. Join us to discover how it all works and unleash your creativity.

name: Creative Writing Secondary
description: In the Creative Writing club, students will dive into the world of words and imagination. They’ll explore different writing styles such as poetry, short stories, and personal narratives while learning key elements like voice, tone, dialogue, and descriptive language. Through guided prompts, group activities, and independent projects, kids will build confidence in their writing, develop their unique style, and have fun expressing themselves creatively.

name: Rock Band 1
description: Each band will have live concerts, weekly rehearsals, and the chance to write and record their own songs. All band members should have at least one private music lesson per week.

name: Japanese Secondary
description: Explore the fascinating world of Japan through its language and culture! Whether you're a beginner or have some experience, this club is for all levels. We’ll learn basic phrases, traditional customs, and fun cultural activities together. Join us to discover a new language and experience Japan in a fun way!

name: Bouldering
description: We climb short climbing walls using special routes made by the students themselves! It’s like solving a puzzle with your body. Climbing shoes give you a big advantage, but they’re optional—you can still have lots of fun without them. Bouldering helps you build strength, balance, and confidence. Come challenge yourself and enjoy climbing with friends!

name: Model UN/Debating
description: For students passionate about finding political solutions to real-world problems, BCS provides an exceptional opportunity to make a meaningful impact. Our student-run Model UN club actively participates in numerous conferences across Berlin and the surrounding areas. This is a fantastic chance to meet new friends from BCS and other schools while engaging in stimulating UN-style debates. Additionally, you can look forward to plenty of cookie breaks to keep the energy high and the atmosphere enjoyable. Embrace this opportunity to develop your diplomatic skills, broaden your perspectives, and contribute to discussions on global issues in a supportive and dynamic environment.

Here, too, the play of dynamics, isolation movements of the whole body characterise and are thus a suitable complement in connection with the technique of jazz dance. name: Abitur/IB Kunst
description: For all Grade 9 and 10 students considering the Visual Arts IB DP or Abitur Bildende Kunst, this program is designed to supplement your half-year art lessons in both grades and prepare you for these courses. You will enhance your technical skills, particularly in observational drawing and painting. Additionally, we will delve deeper into art theory, critical analysis, and help you develop your own artistic voice.

name: Commercial Dance
description: Commercial dance is composed of many urban dance styles as well as jazz elements, which means that there are no limits to creativity when dancing this style. Commercial dance lives from concentrated energy, performance, self-confident posture and expression.

name: Violin 1
description: This is the third music lesson opportunity for most second grade violin students as well as first graders with previous experience and students new to the violin. It is open for students of gr. 1-5 to register. Most students are pre-registered by the music department.

name: Doppeldeutsch am Morgen
description: This is a conversational German support group designed for primary school students who have recently arrived in Germany and currently have little to no knowledge of the German language. The focus of this offering is to provide students with regular and low-threshold exposure to everyday German through guided conversations, interactive language games, and simple vocabulary building activities. The aim is to strengthen their confidence in using the language and to support their integration into daily school life.

name: Violin 2
description: This is the third music lesson opportunity for most second grade violin students as well as first graders with previous experience and students new to the violin. It is open for students of gr. 1-5 to register. Most students are pre-registered by the music department.

name: Tap Dance 2 Performance
description: The basic elements of American Tap Dance are taught here. Through the rhythmic footwork, the learners in class thus become percussion musicians. At the same time, a total body training takes place. Balance, arm and body postures and formations are trained and everything is reflected in a choreographic development.

name: Mandarin-Chinese
description: Experience the joy of learning Chinese in a fun and immersive way through the rich tapestry of Chinese culture. Our program incorporates singing, dancing, playing, and cooking to make language learning engaging and enjoyable. Whether you're exploring traditional songs, delving into cultural dances, participating in interactive games, or cooking delicious Chinese dishes, you'll find that learning Chinese can be both educational and entertaining. Join us and discover the beauty of the Chinese language and culture in a lively environment.

name: Digital art 1
description: Students will learn about the great variety of tools available through digital image editing software and be encouraged to experiment and explore in a creative way with drawing, painting, text, graphics, photo collage, and animation to create their own unique imagery.

name: Skating 1
description: Our free riding Skate Club offers students the opportunity to learn the basics of skating, whether they choose a skateboard, roller-skates, or a scooter. The club also includes fun games and skill contests to keep things exciting. Teachers provide individualized advice to help each student progress at their own pace. Participants improve their skills step by step, including balancing on their board, jumping over obstacles (Ollie), and mastering various tricks in the world of skating.

name: Woodworking
description: In our Woodworking Club, creativity meets craftsmanship. Students specialize in constructing a variety of wooden objects, from intricate figures and delightful toys to engaging board games and challenging puzzles. Whether you're a seasoned woodworker or a curious beginner, you'll find a supportive community eager to share skills and inspire new projects.

name: Zumba 1
description: Latin Fusion blends Latin dance rhythms and movements from styles like Reggaeton, Salsa, Bachata and Merengue with elements from other urban dance styles such as hip hop and commercial.

name: Ballet 2
description: The methodology of the ballet classes is structured to suit the age and anatomy of the children and young people. Objective at the End of the school year: To understand what they have learned and show it in a choreography.

name: Short Films and Videos
description: A club for aspiring videographers, filmmakers, visual artists, designers and storytellers - who would like to learn more about the language and practical techniques of 'moving picture' mediums. Students can produce their own videos and short films with guidance and collaboration, as we look at scenes from old movies, popular YouTubers, media art and animated cartoons. What can we learn from a famous photograph, a pop song, the pace of a comedy sketch or the staging of a play? How does the choice of where we publish or present our work shape how audiences will receive or understand it? The goal of Short Films and Videos club is to create, collaborate, experiment, build skills and have fun!

name: Karate Secondary
description: Learning modern sport karate means learning to fight. The training is designed so that everyone is quickly introduced to karate as a competitive sport. Beginners learn effective attack and defense techniques from the start, such as punches, various kicks, foot sweeps, and deflections. This way, they can gain their first practical experience at tournaments with the yellow belt. The foundation is a balanced physical and motor training, complemented by stretching, exercises to improve general fitness, movement coordination, and reaction. Modern sport karate is not a full-contact sport. Both in training and competition, great emphasis is placed on precise stopping and clean execution of techniques. The risk of injury is much lower than in many trend sports. Since competitive fighting is the best school for effective self-defense, you also have the necessary power for emergencies. Through regular training and competition practice, you gain confidence and self-assurance, especially in tricky situations.
